subject: Re: [junit] Parsing Junit test results
msgSnippet: ... Done in CVS HEAD.  So with a custom stylesheet you should be able to match testcases with the classes they belong to in the report. Stefan
messageBody:
On 27 Aug 2003, Stefan Bodewig <bodewig@...> wrote:

> One of the first steps I'd like to take is to simply add the class
> name of the test class as an attribute to the <testcase> elements,
> this shouldn't break any existing stylesheets and fill a gap that's
> currently there.

Done in CVS HEAD. So with a custom stylesheet you should be able to
match testcases with the classes they belong to in the report.

Stefan
